toc_entry.title: The Real Buddy Holly
toc_entry.description: His life was as short and sweet as his songs, but who was the Lubbock rocker whose influence over popular music will not fade away?

toc_entry.title: Raving On
toc_entry.description: Two decades after he played the role of his life in The Buddy Holly Story, Gary Busey's hero worship has made him his own worst enemy.

toc_entry.title: Reversal of Fortune
toc_entry.description: Boone Pickens and his protégé, David Batchelder, built Mesa Petroleum into an energy giant. Now Pickens’ empire is crumbling and his former aide is leading the charge against him.

toc_entry.title: Swami Dearest
toc_entry.description: In the Hill Country, what was once the hallowed ranch of Walter Prescott Webb is now the sacred site of a mammoth new Hindu temple—and the home of a controversial ashram called Barsana Dham.

toc_entry.title: Hi-Ho Daddy-O!
toc_entry.description: From dancing frogs to towering cowboy boots, a look at how Bob Wade's outlandish sculptures became Texas landmarks.

toc_entry.title: Significant Others
toc_entry.description: Tired of the No. 2 dinner? A new book of recipes collected from California, Arizona, and New Mexico will broaden your Tex-Mex horizons.

toc_entry.title: The News About Jim Lehrer
toc_entry.subtitle: Profile
toc_entry.description: Once an accomplished newscaster and reporter in Dallas, he's still going strong—and now solo—on Pbs.

toc_entry.title: Wasted Days
toc_entry.subtitle: Music
toc_entry.description: Freddy Fender has one of the most affecting voices in the music business. So why isn’t he a star?

toc_entry.title: Walker, Texas Writer
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: Mary Willis Walker’s mysteries aren’t exactly original, but she crafts real moments of tension. That’s why they sell so well and win so many awards.

toc_entry.title: The Yaga Saga
toc_entry.subtitle: Business
toc_entry.description: A year after he was ousted from the Galveston clothing company he founded, Joe Flores is designing a way to out-hip his rivals.

toc_entry.title: Getting His Kicks
toc_entry.subtitle: Television
toc_entry.description: He scored big for Ut and four Nfl teams; now Raúl Allegre is back in the game with his weekly Spanish-language football show.

toc_entry.title: Behind the Lines
toc_entry.description: The death of a federal program in Amarillo shows that cutting the budget isn’t the answer to everything.

toc_entry.title: Roar of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: For and against our “Silicone City” cover; the politics of breast implants; who killed the Patient Protection Act?

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Phil Gramm’s master plan for defeating Dole, whipping Wilson, and locking up the Gop nomination. Plus: Ann Richards stages a comeback, Jane Roe flips for a preacher, tainted Mexican pols sign up a Corpus Christi lawyer, and Hollywood goes for Rig Rend in a big way.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: Opera star Leontyne Price makes a rare stop in Austin. Plus: The legends of women’s tennis hit Houston and the “Home of the Hamburger” cookoff sizzles in Athens.
toc_entry.byline: Edited by Quita McMath, Jill Becker, and Erin Gromen

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Joe Jamail fights the power. Plus: Who will save the Texas Democratic party?
toc_entry.byline: by Paul Burka and Jan Russell
